ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Pets vs. Familiars
ygData.msgSnippet: A familiar is a selfbuff with a graphic representation. Nothing more, mothing less. Its there as some VI coder thought it was fun. It has no real meaning and
ygData.messageBody:
A familiar is a selfbuff with a graphic representation. Nothing more,
mothing less. Its there as some VI coder thought it was fun. It has no real
meaning and you can do /pet get lost to get rid of the visual and the
buffing icon stays.



-----Original Message-----
From: Steven R. Hulse [mailto:steve@...]
Sent: Friday, July 19, 2002 8:09 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Pets vs. Familiars


I've noticed lately there are now "Familiars" that people have. How do
these differ from Pets? Also when you die and have a "familiar" do you
have to reconjure them up like you do a pet or do they come back when
you do? And finally who all can have a "familiar"?

Thanks!
